# Recipe: Stovetop Garlic Mushroom Pasta

## Introduction
Stovetop Garlic Mushroom Pasta is a delicious and easy-to-make dish that combines the earthy flavors of mushrooms with the aromatic punch of garlic. This recipe is perfect for a quick weeknight meal or when you want to impress guests with minimal effort. The creamy sauce coats the pasta perfectly, making every bite a delight.

## Ingredients
- 8 ounces (225g) of pasta (linguine, fettuccine, or spaghetti)
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 4 cloves of garlic, minced
- 8 ounces (225g) of mushrooms, sliced (button mushrooms or cremini mushrooms work well)
- 1 cup (240ml) of vegetable broth
- 1 cup (240ml) of heavy cream
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)

## Equipment
- Large pot for boiling pasta
- Large skillet or frying pan
- Wooden spoon or spatula
- Knife for mincing garlic
- Cutting board
- Measuring cups and spoons

## Preparation Time
- 10 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 20 minutes

## Steps
1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
2. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat.
3. Add the minced garlic to the pan and saut√© for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
4. Add the sliced mushrooms to the pan and cook for 5-6 minutes until they release their moisture and start to brown.
5. Pour in the vegetable broth and bring to a simmer. Cook for another 2-3 minutes until the broth reduces slightly.
6. Reduce the heat to low and stir in the heavy cream. Simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens slightly.
7. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Add the cooked pasta to the skillet and toss to coat it evenly with the sauce.
9. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the pasta is heated through.
10. Remove from heat and garnish with freshly chopped parsley.
11. Serve hot and enjoy!

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the Stovetop Garlic Mushroom Pasta as a main dish with a side of garlic bread and a green salad.
- Pair it with a glass of white wine for an extra touch of elegance.

## Variations
- For a vegetarian version, substitute vegetable broth for chicken broth.
- Add cooked chicken or shrimp to make it a heartier meal.
- Sprinkle grated Parmesan cheese on top before serving for an added depth of flavor.

## Tips and Tricks
- Make sure to cook the pasta al dente, as it will continue to cook slightly when added to the sauce.
- If the sauce is too thick, add a splash of vegetable broth or pasta cooking water to thin it out.
- Feel free to add other vegetables like spinach or cherry tomatoes for added color and nutrients.

## Nutritional Information
- The nutritional information for this recipe may vary depending on the type and quantity of ingredients used. Here is an approximate breakdown per serving:
  - Calories: 450
  - Fat: 25g
  - Carbohydrates: 45g
  - Protein: 10g

## Storage and Leftovers
- Stovetop Garlic Mushroom Pasta is best enjoyed fresh. However, if you have leftovers, store them in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
- Reheat the pasta in a skillet or microwave, adding a little vegetable broth or cream to revive the sauce if needed.

## Frequently Asked Questions
1. Can I use a different type of pasta?
   - Yes, you can use any type of pasta you prefer or have on hand. Linguine, fettuccine, or spaghetti work well in this recipe.
2. Can I use dried mushrooms instead of fresh?
   - While fresh mushrooms are recommended for this recipe, you can use rehydrated dried mushrooms if you prefer. Just make sure to drain them well and adjust the cooking time accordingly.
3. Can I make this recipe vegan?
   - Yes, you can make a vegan version of this recipe by substituting the heavy cream with a non-dairy alternative like coconut cream or cashew cream.
